io.atomix.storage.buffer

Interface BufferInput<T extends BufferInput<?>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Buffer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBuffer, ByteBufferBuffer, DirectBuffer, FileBuffer, HeapBuffer, MappedBuffer, NativeBuffer, ReadOnlyBuffer, SlicedBuffer, SnapshotReader, SwappedBuffer, UnsafeDirectBuffer, UnsafeHeapBuffer, UnsafeMappedBuffer

    public interface BufferInput<T extends BufferInput<?>>
extends AutoCloseable
    Readable buffer.

    This interface exposes methods for reading from a byte buffer. Readable buffers maintain a small amount of state regarding current cursor positions and limits similar to the behavior of ByteBuffer.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • position

        int position()
        Returns the buffer's current read/write position.

        The position is an internal cursor that tracks where to write/read bytes in the underlying storage implementation. As bytes are written to or read from the buffer, the position will advance based on the number of bytes read.

        Returns:
        The buffer's current position.

      • remaining

        int remaining()
        Returns the number of bytes remaining in the input.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes remaining in the input.

      • hasRemaining

        boolean hasRemaining()
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether the input has bytes remaining.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether bytes remain to be read from the input.

      • skip

        T skip(int bytes)
        Skips the given number of bytes in the input.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The number of bytes to attempt to skip.
        Returns:
        The skipped input.
